thread.title: 12th-warmest January on record didn't stop the snow
thread.title_full: 12th-warmest January on record didn't stop the snow

author: Detroit Free Press
title: 12th-warmest January on record didn't stop the snow
text:
Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email 12th-warmest January on record didn't stop the snow The exceptionally sun-free month wasn't as cold as usual, but last-minute snow pushed snowfall totals to average. Post to Facebook 12th-warmest January on record didn't stop the snow The exceptionally sun-free month wasn't as cold as usual, but last-minute snow pushed snowfall totals to average. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs 12th-warmest January on record didn't stop the snow Matt Helms , Detroit Free Press Published 1:25 p.m. ET Feb. 1, 2017 | Updated 1 hour ago Ontayveis Underwood sprinkles salt after clearing snow from a neighbor's driveway and sidewalk in Saginaw on Tuesday morning, Jan. 10, 2017, after four to five inches of snow fell around Saginaw County. (Photo: Jeff Schrier/The Saginaw News via AP) 
January was very warm in metro Detroit — one of the warmest on record — but still managed to come close to average in snowfall, the National Weather Service said today. 
Metro Detroit saw 11.8 inches of snow reported at Detroit Metro Airport for the dreadfully sun-free month. The historical average for January is 12.5 inches, said meteorologist Jordan Dale with the weather service’s office in White Lake Township. 
“All in all, most points ended up close to average, and that’s mostly because of the last couple of days because we had steady snowfall,” Dale said.
